results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Brett Mahon
results.brief_description: As part of the end of year screening for the Swinburne, EDIM (Electronic Design and Interactive Media) course - those students who had completed interactive coursework were required to create a linear representation of their work for the showreel. Tis student should be contacted and asked to submit to the Interactive collection

results.title: The Girl I love: music video for the band Positronic
results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Stephen Clarke
results.brief_description: This animated music video was created in 3D studio Max for student’s band - Positronic. Although it was the first time that he had used this software, he makes the most of simple scenes, metaphorical imagery and 3D ariel effects to effectively communicate the song’s message - A small town girl leaves her home to find fame and fortune in the big city, leaving beind her boyfriend who must come to terms with her departure.
results.title_for_label: The Girl I love: music video for the band Positronic
results.creator_credit_for_label: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Stephen Clarke

results.title: Swimming with Mark Tonelli
results.brief_description: This series offers instructional assistance from swimmers Mark Tonelli and Drew Mayhew in a number of strokes.
results.description: This series offers instructional assistance from swimmers Mark Tonelli and Drew Mayhew in a number of strokes.
description_for_label: This series offers instructional assistance from swimmers Mark Tonelli and Drew Mayhew in a number of strokes.
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly, freestyle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Swimming with Mark Tonelli”.
A compilation tape containing five programmes designed to instruct on swimming techniques. 1.Backstroke. Demonstrated by Commonwealth Gold Medallist Mark Tonelli. 2.Breaststroke. Demonstrated by British Gold Medallist Duncan Tonelli. 3.Butterfly. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli. 4. Freestyle. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli. 5.Starts and Turns. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli and Drew Mayhew.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Swimming with Mark Tonelli”.
A compilation tape containing five programmes designed to instruct on swimming techniques. 1.Backstroke. Demonstrated by Commonwealth Gold Medallist Mark Tonelli. 2.Breaststroke. Demonstrated by British Gold Medallist Duncan Tonelli. 3.Butterfly. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli. 4. Freestyle. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli. 5.Starts and Turns. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli and Drew Mayhew.

group_siblings.title: Swimming
group_siblings.creator_credit: Gold Medal Productions

results.title: Swimming
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Swimming with Mark Tonelli”.
Approved by the Department of Education, this video is designed for swimming instruction. Mark Tonelli and Duncan Goodhew, both Olympic gold medallists, give instruction on freestyle, breaststroke, backstroke, butterfly and the mechanics of swimming. Each stroke is treated as a separate entity. Teacher’s notes are also available.

group_works.title: The Sprint crawl
group_works.creator_credit: Dr Frank Ryan and Ryan Films

results.title: The Sprint crawl
results.creator_credit: Dr Frank Ryan and Ryan Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Swimming Instruction”.
A close study of the competitive swimming stroke, “the sprint crawl”. With the aid of diagrams and slow-motion photography, the film analyses the action of the arm stroke, the leg kick, the pool-edge turning and the initial diving.
results.description:
